I'll cut to the chase; I found a staple in one of the tempura vegetables in the tempura appetizer. It must have made its way into the batter. I was chewing the food then I bit into this hard thing. "Great..." I thought. I pulled it out and placed it on a plate. As a side note, the shrimp tempura tasted a bit funky, like it was old. When the waitress returned with my Francisco roll, I promptly pointed it out. She apologized, but they didn't bother to comp us in any way. Unfortunately, this is typical of restaurants when you find something in the food, but it's unacceptable. We're not talking about bringing out the wrong order; we're talking about a health hazard. Anyway, my sushi roll was fine, nothing wrong with it (though I was paranoid and inspected the pieces before each bite). My boyfriend said the mushroom and tofu ramen was ok. He didn't like that the noodles were mushy but maybe they were supposed to be that way? We're not ramen experts...

Well, nice service, food came out fast, but yeah, super put off by the staple.
author: Opal L.

description: I wanted to like this place so badly. Pretty much what other reviews have said though. Cold, crappy food that arrived late, a seriously lazy delivery driver, and a pretty bad experience. It couldn't be more obvious they just don't care.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I saw their place menus on my door so thought I would give them a try. But very disappointed. This is the worst ramen I've tasted ever. The noodle soup tastes are not authentic. 

I have been to another place called Ramen Yamadaya in Japantown. This restanrant is  running by Japanese owner. And it tasted very authentic and traditional. It's as the same as the ramen I have tried in Japan. Compare with Ramen Yamadaya, Jika Ramen is nothing. It is not made by real pork soup but actually some powder. It's artificial and unhealthy.
author: Jessy L.

description:
the driver was actually yelling at me!  

And the refund i requested was the only about the tip for him.  not the food, which btw is mediocre.  Yet, they refused even a partial refund.  

Certainly never order from them again. 

Tip was prepaid because i used GrubHub .  they at least tried to help, but i hope they drop this place.
author: V J.

description: Nothing good, mediocre. I ordered delivery since I loved the Chinese joint that used to occupy the storefront, hoping that their chow mein would still be excellent. Not the case. not the standard chow mein noodles, which is not bad per se, just unexpected. what WAS bad though, was the fact that the skin of the onion made it into the food. California rolls were decent, but miso/salad/teriyaki chicken were not worth the price. I would order again if nothing else were open.
author: Josh R.

description: Absolutely if you want sushi at mid night, this is one of the place you can order delivery.  I am sashimi fan and this is cheaper than order restaurant, especially sashimi.  BUT!!!!  Sashimi is very thin and not fresh at all.   Although it is just 23 dollar for 20 pcs assorted sashimi, I don't think it worth with it.  DO NOT check the sashimi photo that other people posted.  You will know it is totally different thing.  Or maybe it is just for me, shouldn't crave with sashimi in the afternoon and midnight.
author: Tissuebabee S.

description: Husband and I thought we'd try out this local ramen restaurant! Pleasantly surprised. Great food and wonderful friendly staff. Food, fish is fresh and tasty.  And I have to say that the prices are reasonable. I have not tried their delivery, but I have picked up food from here, still awesome and tasty. Three cheers for this place!!!
author: Caring C.

description:
Their delivery is great. Our food has been consistently awesome every time we've ordered from here. The fish has always been fresh and tasty and the food is great for the price. Oh! They put enoki mushrooms in the miso! 

When I sat down and ate there, my experience wasn't quite as good. I ordered a hot sake, two rolls and three nigiri. I was a little concerned because my waitress didn't recognize any of the sushi I ordered, and I had to point to each thing in the menu. About ten minutes later she came back with one roll and one nigiri packaged to go, and my check. I tried to ask her about the hot sake and the rest of my order, and she just said yes and pointed to my order of ebi. I gave up and went home. Not a big deal, but I'm glad I wasn't on a date. 

I will definitely keep ordering delivery from here, but I'm not sure I'll go back for a sit down.
author: Fiona F.

description: Horrible! Bad food, terrible service. Took two hours to get our food and when it came it was inedible.  I've made better raman at home from a package. Not one thing we got tasted good. We called the restaurant and told them we were not satisfied and they were rude to us then hung up abruptly. We told grub hub and they called five times and couldn't get to talk to a manager. I would never order from this place again and I recommend that you don't waste your money. You will NOT be happy. It's not cheap and completely inedible. We wasted our time and had to have sandwiches for dinner.  Be warned they have bad reviews for a reason, don't waste your money!
author: Skye M.

description: Is horrible,  their website said they are open daily, but that is not true. I went there today which is a Thursday at 1:30 pm and they are actually closed.
author: Sally C.

description: They're open late and they have great sushi. I got a Philadelphia hand roll and it was delicious. Their servers are very attentive and the prices are very reasonable. Would recommend to anyone looking for cheap, quick sushi fix!
author: Sam D.

description: Overall pretty tasty. Their food is good, and despite some initial slow service I've had good luck ordering for pickup. Go there if you live nearby.
author: Dietrich D.

description: Friendly service, accomodating for my 2 year old, free edamame, tasty noodles and soup!
author: waiming B.

description: So sad to give this place only two stars, yet they just open up. The food was ok, but the server was very slow, did not paid much attention to us. The other server or helper was very rude. He brought to our table one of our dish we have ordered with such an attitude that shocked us. Then we spend probably 15 minutes if waiting to make our server charged us and when he appear to the table to grab our credit card, he was on his cell which is really Rudy to the guest-us! The place look like a old place that was in business over 10 years, I wish they updated and make sure the place is clean and NO FLYES flying around. So sad that this "new" place is dead to us. I would not recommend this place to my friends!!!
author: Yana Y.

description: The waitress was pretty. The delivery man was handsome. The foods were fresh. I like this place.
author: Justin Z.

description: Nobody should come here! My boyfriend and I came here a few days ago for dinner since he was craving for Ramen. We decided to come here since it took us forever to find parking by Genki Ramen in Geary and it was way easier by this place. I ordered the grilled pork and stir fry veggies and he ordered the shrimp tempura ramen. My boyfriend said that the ramen wasn't bad and my dish was pretty decent as well however a bit on the oily side. On that very day after we left, my boyfriend had to go to the bathroom instantly and I thought it was just a normal thing. The next day he was hit with food poisoning. He had the bad case of diarrhea and even noticed blood in his stool after throwing up twice. The whole day he wouldn't stop going to the bathroom. I would not recommend this place and should have never came here when I saw they didn't have such good ratings already. If nobody wants to have to go to the ER, I would skip this place.
author: Teresa W.

description:
food: 1/5
service: 3/5

Came here on a weeknight with my friend and the place was full but not packed. Many people actually do take out here. The food is very bland and not made well here. I ordered the combo with pork katsu and unagi rice. The pork katsu was soo tough and dry, it was deifinitely over cooked. Also the unagi rice is not slices of unagi over white rice, it is chinese fried rice with unagi bits in it. Did not taste good. My friend ordered an egg side dish which was supposed to be soft boiled. When it came out, the egg was not seasoned at all and was hardboiled rock solid. They don't even know how to boil eggs correctly.  

Service was good but slow. They are definitely understaffed. The kitchen is also understaffed because it took everyone at least 30 minutes to get their food. I think this place really tries to be good with the nice menus and decor. But they just don't know how to run a restaurant business. 2 stars because they really try but the skill is just not there.
author: Cecile S.

description: For late night delivery Sushi, this place is damn fine. Miso soup was great.  Used real crab in California rolls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Adam G.

description: Arrived 6:15PM to an empty restaurant. My review: Zero. Dreadful. Avoid. Details: I ordered Baked Oysters from the appetizer section five minutes after we sat down. Ten minutes later I ordered Hot Spicy Vegetarian Kimchee Ramen (kimchi misspelled on their menu) and my wife ordered Hokkaido Scallops Ramen. My ramen arrived in 15 minutes and I thought I smelled dirty mop, I've mopped a lot of floors, I know what it smells like. I picked up my fork and took a few bites of the warm food and realized that there was a film of something, like grease, on the underside of the fork. I put the folk down and continued with chop sticks. My wife gave me her fork after saying it was dirty too. My ramen was tasteless. The "kimchee", of course, had some spice. There were a few under-cooked broccoli florets, unevenly cut cubes of tofu and some other stuff. The liquid had no flavor, it wasn't salted or anything else added. I stopped eating and told my wife the Baked Oysters were probably not coming and that's good because there is "no way that four baked oysters ordered for appetizer should take 30+ minutes". A few minutes later my wife said "oysters are coming". I did not have the guts to take a picture and I certainly did not try one. I almost did but I couldn't do it. In hindsight the waitress told me the story of the new Chinese owners and added "Sushi was easy to make, that's why they bought a Japanese restaurant." My reply was "That's really interesting." I should have walked out then. Normally I would go back again and try something else but I have a bad taste in my mouth so I won't do it. There are better restaurants around the corner on Judah, what a pity.
author: Mike S.

description: It's really good for the cheaper pricing. Their miso soup is the best, they put mushrooms and a bunch of tofu. It's open late and delivers so it's just what I need somethimes when all the other restaurants are closed. Their ramen is okay. Over all I enjoy their food.
author: Jessica J.

description: We went to this place despite pretty bad prior reviews and I am glad we did.  It did not disappoint.  Everything we ordered was very tasty and fresh including raw fish.
author: Yuliya M.

description: First time order for delivery gave them my credit card to charge the amount they asked for.  They called me back said they under charged me and needed to run my credit card again. Okay fine! I gave them another chance today and they did the same thing. If you asked them amount over the phone, make sure you will have extra money with you cuz it seems like the price goes up all the time.
author: W T.

description: Pretty good food, but they make you wait too long for it. My friends and I came here and waited 45 minutes (there were two other tables in the entire place) and not only did they bring out one person's food before everyone else's, but my chicken was still raw and took them another 30 minutes to cook it fully. The dude who works there was super rude to me for sending it back, but I prefer to live my life salmonella-free. Sorry, bro. Everyone else was nice but it just took too long. I shouldn't have to wait that long to get some ramen and skewers.
author: Molly W.

description: The ramen here was really tasty. We also had a couple sushi rolls and they were good too. It was also super cheap (by SF standards). The service was a little funky, maybe a language barrier, but we were the only ones in there so it was all good. Happy to have this place down the street.
author: J.D. E.

description: Would give 0 stars if I could. I was in search of a late night delivery, and saw on grub hub that they deliver until 2 AM. I ordered through grub hub and got my confirmation email quoting me an hour. 2 hours later, still no food. I called them and the rude man on the phone not only told me they never received my order, but also hung up on me...twice. What a waste of my time and now it's 1 AM and I'm still without food. Don't bother with this place. If I get charged for the meal I didn't receive it will be a whole other story.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I've ordered take-out from here a couple of times and have been completely satisfied with the price and quality of food. It's also open super late which is awesome.
author: Beth M.

description: We were nervous coming in due to lack of reviews and low rating. It's in walking distance and I craved sushi so... We braved it!  Miso was yummy and generous portion and full of yummy mushrooms and seaweed. Ikura was yum. Hamachi too. California roll was quite nice, tobiko tasty, rice was fluffy!!!  The hand rolls are hearty-lots of rice and I liked their wasabi and ginger. Overall quite good. We'll be back!!!
author: Tamara C.
